image.alt: Reception area at Arlington Heights Orthodontics & Pediatric Dentistry

paragraphs.text: Arlington Heights Orthodontics & Pediatric Dentistry is your one‑stop shop for quality orthodontic care and pediatric dentistry. We provide personalized, gentle care for children and patients of all ages, combining a family-friendly approach with modern technology and board‑certified specialists to create healthy, confident smiles.
Learn about our pediatric office and the services we offer, from routine prevention to orthodontics and specialty care, delivered in a welcoming environment designed for children and families.

items.title: Locally Owned
items.text: Trusted in Arlington Heights since 1971, our family practice cares for generations of local patients.

items.title: Board‑Certified Team
items.text: Orthodontists and pediatric dentists on staff provide advanced, expert care for patients of every age.

items.title: Tailored Care
items.text: We welcome infants, kids, teens, and patients with special needs, customizing treatment plans to each child's needs.

items.title: Modern Comfort
items.text: Modern, clean facilities with laser frenectomies and multiple sedation options to keep visits comfortable and effective.

testimonials.author: Lisa O., Arlington Heights, IL
testimonials.testimonial: “I highly recommend Arlington Heights Orthodontics. I've been a patient with them for many years and recently returned to be fitted for a night guard. The night guard didn't fit right, but Dr. Kemp was very persistent in making adjustments until I was 100% happy with it. He is always very good‑natured and great to talk to. A huge thank you to Dr. Kemp and the staff. I appreciate them.”

og_meta.title: Arlington Heights Orthodontics & Pediatric Dentistry
og_meta.description: Comprehensive orthodontic and pediatric dental care in Arlington Heights, IL, including braces, clear aligners, laser frenectomy, and special‑needs dentistry.

image.alt: Arlington Heights Orthodontics team interior banner

paragraphs.text: Here at Arlington Heights Orthodontics & Pediatric Dentistry, our specialists provide a full range of care for growing smiles. Whether children need braces for a lifetime of healthy alignment or focused pediatric dentistry to protect baby teeth and gums today, our team has the training and experience to meet those needs.

We combine modern, clean clinical care with a family-friendly approach. Locally owned since 1971, our practice blends long-standing community ties with board-certified specialists in orthodontics and pediatric dentistry to deliver dependable, patient-focused care.

Our office emphasizes comfort, convenience, and clear communication. We offer flexible scheduling, gentle techniques, and an approach tailored to each child and family so treatment fits their lifestyle and makes sense long term.

Jeffrey Kemp, DDS is a skilled orthodontist with more than three decades of clinical experience. He enjoys transforming smiles and helping patients gain confidence through high-quality orthodontic care.
Dr. Kemp approaches each case with a focus on individualized treatment planning and long-term oral health, working closely with families to find the best solution for children, teens, and adults.

image.alt: Dr. Jeffrey Kemp smiling in office

paragraphs.text: Dr. Kemp holds a Doctor of Dental Surgery (DDS) and chose orthodontics as his specialty. Over his career he has focused on clinical excellence and patient-centered care, helping generations of families in the local community.

Outside the office, Dr. Kemp is an endurance athlete and outdoors enthusiast. He has completed Ironman triathlons, qualified for the Boston Marathon twice, plays golf, snowboards, and enjoys woodworking and stained glass projects.
In 2006 he made the remarkable decision to donate a kidney to a family member, and he remains active in the local community he serves.

Christopher Hall, DMD is a board-certified orthodontist who treats patients of all ages. His clinical focus is delivering precise, predictable orthodontic results with a calm, patient-centered approach.

Dr. Hall comes from a dental family and developed an early interest in dentistry. He achieved board certification through the American Board of Orthodontics, a distinction that reflects his commitment to advanced training and clinical standards.
When not treating patients, Dr. Hall enjoys playing and practicing golf, traveling, and spending time with family and friends around Arlington Heights.

Justin Welke, DDS is a board-certified pediatric dentist and a Diplomate of the American Board of Pediatric Dentistry. He provides comprehensive pediatric dental care for children of all ages, including those with special health care needs.

Dr. Welke is experienced working with children across a wide range of needs, including medically complex and special-needs patients. He is known for a gentle chairside manner and an ability to build trust with young patients and their families.

Fluent in Spanish, Dr. Welke volunteers with at‑risk populations in Chicago and enjoys spending time with his wife and son. He also coaches youth basketball and enjoys following local and college sports.

Megan Davenport, DDS is a caring pediatric dentist who focuses on prevention and creating positive experiences for young patients. She began her career in community health before specializing in pediatric dentistry.

Dr. Davenport emphasizes early prevention and education, helping children and families adopt lifelong habits that support healthy teeth. She strives to make each visit comfortable and empowering for kids.
At home Dr. Davenport enjoys family life with her husband and children. Her hobbies include hiking, baking, and cheering on college football.

Priya Katwala, DDS is a dedicated pediatric dentist who enjoys building long-term relationships with patients and their families. She is committed to advocating for children’s oral health and delivering reliable, customized care.

image.alt: Dr. Katwala treating a young patient

paragraphs.text: Dr. Katwala grew up locally and found her calling early, participating in enrichment programs that exposed her to healthcare careers. She brings that lifelong interest in pediatric care to every appointment.
Outside the office, Dr. Katwala enjoys spending time with her family, playing tennis, and following Formula 1 and the Chicago Bulls. A fun personal note is that she is left-handed.

Shiloh Golden, DDS is an orthodontist who blends art and science to help patients achieve healthy, confident smiles. He focuses on clear communication and treatment plans that fit each patient’s goals.

Dr. Golden originally planned a different career path but chose dentistry after a personal experience with dental trauma sparked his interest. He pursued orthodontics to combine his interest in hands-on problem solving with patient care.
Outside work, Dr. Shiloh enjoys staying active, trying new restaurants, playing golf, and spending time with his wife, children, and their two dogs. He is also a fan of the Chicago Bulls.

Our doctors and team volunteer with local pediatric organizations, support at‑risk populations, and participate in outreach that helps children access dental and orthodontic care.

paragraphs.text: Ready to request an appointment? Use our online form to tell us about your needs, share preferred times, and provide basic health details so we can prepare for your visit. Request an appointment online: https://www.ahorthopeds.com/request-an-appointment.html
Prefer to ask a question first? Visit our contact page for directions, hours, and a quick way to get in touch: https://www.ahorthopeds.com/contact.html

image.alt: Parent and child speaking with a friendly front-desk team member

paragraphs.text: To schedule your first visit, complete the appointment form so our team can review your needs and prepare for your appointment. The form is the fastest way to request available times and provide necessary background: https://www.ahorthopeds.com/request-an-appointment.html
If you need help with the form or prefer to speak with us directly, visit our contact page for phone and location details: https://www.ahorthopeds.com/contact.html

Completing health history information before your visit helps us provide safe, efficient care. If specific intake forms are required, you can usually access them through the appointment request page or we will send them after you submit the request.
If you don’t see a required form online, please note it in your appointment request or contact our office so we can make the right paperwork available.

image.alt: Patient filling out intake forms online
Call to schedule or request an appointment online

image.alt: Young woman smiling after visiting the orthodontist

paragraphs.text: Say the word “orthodontics” to anyone, and metal braces are probably the first thing they’ll think about. The traditional approach of using brackets and wires to move the teeth remains the best solution for severe crowding, misalignment, and oral malocclusion.

At Arlington Heights Orthodontics & Pediatric Dentistry, we’re proud to offer a clear path to a straighter smile that doesn’t involve any wires or brackets. With clear aligners, you or your teenager can enjoy a convenient, discreet way to address many orthodontic concerns.

image.alt: Closeup of patient after Clear Aligners in Arlington Heights

paragraphs.text: Ceramic braces work like traditional metal braces but use clear or tooth-colored materials so they blend in with your smile. They provide effective correction with a more discreet appearance for image-conscious patients.

image.alt: a closeup of a person’s mouth who has ceramic braces

paragraphs.text: With self-ligating braces, the orthodontic wire isn’t attached to the brackets with elastics. Instead, small doors hold the wire in place, allowing it to move more naturally with the teeth. This can make treatment more comfortable and sometimes faster, with fewer adjustments required.

image.alt: Model smile with Damon self-ligating braces

paragraphs.text: Lingual braces attach to the tongue side of the teeth rather than the front surfaces, making them virtually invisible to others. They can correct many orthodontic issues while remaining discreet, though they may not be suitable for every complex case.

Preventive care helps stop small problems from becoming big ones. We use dental sealants to smooth the grooves of molars and reduce cavities, and we offer silver diamine fluoride to halt decay comfortably for patients who avoid drilling.

An oral health risk assessment identifies each child’s decay risk so we can tailor follow-up care. We also guide parents on teething, how to manage non-nutritive habits like thumb sucking, and provide custom athletic mouthguards to protect young smiles during sports.
When a tooth is damaged by decay or injury, we restore form and function with tooth-colored fillings that preserve natural enamel and stay discreet.
For more advanced damage we place dental crowns to protect and restore baby or permanent teeth, and perform pulpotomy procedures when needed to save a tooth with affected pulp tissue.

image.alt: Dentist examining child after tooth colored filling restoration

paragraphs.text: Nitrous oxide helps children relax during treatment while remaining awake and able to follow instructions. It works quickly and wears off fast, making it a good option for routine procedures.
IV sedation provides a deeper level of relaxation for very fearful patients or long procedures. Our team monitors vitals throughout to keep care safe and comfortable.
For extensive cases we coordinate general anesthesia with specially trained providers, completing a thorough medical history and making sure each child is an appropriate candidate before proceeding.

image.alt: Child receiving nitrous oxide dental sedation
